page.title: 09SAINTFIELD INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: The first part of this building was erected in 1963,and extended to over 5 acres in 1965.It was formerly a factory that produced knitting and carpet yarn,but when so many similar factories closed,the building was divided into 20 small businesses employing over 100 people. {CASEMENT WINDOWS:}Here they make UPVC windows.The machines required come from Germany. {SAMSON YARNS:}This firm produces synthetic fibre from plastic pellets which are supplied by oil refineries. There are 22 tonnes of polypropylene pellets imported from Belgium monthly. The molten plastic is extruded through small holes forming thin strands,then stretched on hot rollers for strength. The fibres are used to make horse harness straps,elastic and mattress cloth,some is exported to England.
